Text.Value: At least you've made Shar happy. Or whatever passes for 'happy' with her.
Shar is no doubt pleased. Though I'm not sure I care for the pleasures of such a goddess.
Your goddess is appeased, then. How grand for you.
Shar must be thrilled. Congratulations.
Hope your miserable god is delighted with herself.
You have shed the rarest of blood for your goddess, Shadowheart. I hope it was worth it to you.
You have earned your place as a Dark Justiciar of Shar.
Let's hope the Lady of Loss is pleased.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Karlach: Dripping with derision
Wyll: Dripping with derision
Halsin - bitter

Text.Value: Do you feel better now, Shadowheart? A little less tense?
A cruel fate for such a wondrous being. Is there so little room for light in you, Shadowheart?
It is done. The Nightsong is no more.
By the gone gods, what great light have you gone and quenched?
That was hard to watch. Hope it was worth it, Shadowheart.
A sorry outcome.
The Nightsong is silenced. You have done well, Shadowheart.
It's done, Shadowheart.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Karlach: High derision. She doesn't support what just happened.
Halsin - bitter

Text.Value: With her free, Ketheric is exposed. We only have to strike.
Ketheric has the wrath of the heavens upon him now. And no hope of resurrection.
Ketheric Thorm's immortal no longer. He will know true death at our hands.
The Nightsong will tear Ketheric to shreds. I wouldn't miss it for the world.
Can't wait to see her cleave Ketheric's head in two.
And with her free, Thorm is vulnerable. The time to strike is upon us.
Ketheric is vulnerable now. We should hasten to Moonrise, lest our angelic friend kills him before we have a chance to.
Ketheric's vulnerable now. All we have to do is strike.
Should... should we kill her again?
When she resurrects, she'll have no interest in helping us.
Going forward, stay your hand. In her death, we'll find neither purpose nor pleasure.
Not her first death, or her last. Is there no end to her suffering?
No sense in making her suffer more. Not after what she's been through.
How many times has she died and returned? How much agony has she endured...?
It would be a waste of effort to strike her again.
Wonder how many times she's been killed down here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Karlach: Reacting to Nightsong being killed, who she relates to. She'd be pissed/ sad.

Text.Value: She does seem like a powerful ally. I just hope she's powerful enough.
An aasimar for an ally. I feel the odds shifting in our favour already.
By all the planes - she is a mighty force, one I'm glad to call an ally.
Incredible. She'll make a powerful ally, all fury and light.
Fuck yes. She's incredible. Well-chosen, Shadowheart.
You chose well, Shadowheart. You may have angered your goddess, but now we have an aasimar as an ally.
I hope her bite is equal to her bark.
What a sight. We chose a powerful ally.
At least Shar will be happy. Or whatever passes for 'happy' with her.
Shar is no doubt pleased. Though I'm not sure I care for the pleasures of such a goddess.
Your goddess is satisfied. Or so I hope, for your sake.
I'm sure your dark goddess is proud...
Hope you made She of the Absolute Misery feel better.
You have shed the rarest of blood for your goddess, Shadowheart. I hope it was worth it to you.
I hope your goddess appreciates the blood you have shed for her, Shadowheart.
I hope your goddess is pleased.
Let's hope we backed the right horse. Or the right nightmare.
Let's hope she doesn't seek revenge. I don't fancy facing an aasimar's wrath.
With every choice, a consequence. We haven't seen the last of the Nightsong.
This doesn't sit right with me. We've travelled a dark path.
I didn't sign up for this.
That was not just foolish. It was immoral.
I question the wisdom of that decision.
Hopefully this will all be over soon.
Let's hope we backed the right horse. Or the right nightmare.
Let's hope she doesn't seek revenge. I don't fancy facing an aasimar's wrath.
With every choice, a consequence. We haven't seen the last of the Nightsong.
This doesn't sit right with me. We've travelled a dark path.
What goes around comes around. We're going to pay for this.
That was not just foolish. It was immoral.
Doing Balthazar's bidding sickens me, but if it gets us closer to Ketheric, so be it.
Let's hope we chose the right ally.
She does seem like a powerful ally. I just hope she's powerful enough.
An aasimar for an ally. I feel the odds shifting in our favour already.
A well-chosen ally. In her suffering, she's found strength.
The right choice - she's quite something, isn't she?
She's incredible.
She shall be a powerful ally against Ketheric Thorm. I look forward to witnessing her power unleashed against him.
A righteous and furious ally. Impressive.
We've made a powerful ally today.

EditorData.NodeContext: Karlach note: She just saw Dame Aylin go full celestial buff armour angel and is highly impressed.

Text.Value: Well, she's Ketheric's now. Her fate's in his hands.
Rather ruthless of you to just hand her over like that.
The choice is made, and fate is written.
Doomed to suffer. A tragedy many times over.
How could you let that corpse take her?!
We just surrendered her...? She could have helped us put a stop to Ketheric Thorm!
She was defiant for a caged beast. Moonrise will break her.
We did what we had to do.
She's definitely immortal - no question about that.
Her death will be temporary, but her anger... that will be permanent.
Immortal, indeed. And angry for certain.
By the gone gods, what have we done?
Oh goody. We've pissed off the immortal.
She is immortal - and enraged. What have we done...?
My family have a saying: 'Do not provoke what you cannot kill'.
Well, she wasn't lying - she's immortal.
Do you feel better now, Shadowheart? A little less tense?
A cruel fate for such a wondrous being. Is there so little room for light in you, Shadowheart?
Vicious. Only a coward refuses her challenger the chance to fight back.
Gods - she was an absolute wonder, and you destroyed her.
You killed her. After all she'd been through.
A sorry outcome.
The Nightsong is silenced. You have done well, Shadowheart.
The Nightsong is dead. Permanently.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Karlach: Dripping with derision
Halsin - bitter

Text.Value: Let's hope we backed the right horse. Or the right nightmare.
Let's hope she doesn't seek revenge. I don't fancy facing an aasimar's wrath.
Our ally is chosen. There is no going back.
A terrible choice for which we'll all pay a price.
That was wrong. And we're going to pay for it.
That was not just foolish. It was immoral.
Doing Balthazar's bidding sickens me, but if it gets us closer to Ketheric, so be it.
I hope we chose the right ally.
I'm glad you let her go - she seems like a powerful ally.
An aasimar for an ally. I feel the odds shifting in our favour already.
A well-chosen ally. In her suffering, she's found strength.
Well chosen - she's quite something, isn't she?
She's incredible. You did the right thing.
An aasimar at our side. I can think of few allies that could match her.
I hope her bite is equal to her bark.
A powerful ally. Well-chosen, Shadowheart.
Gods, what a hellish thing to be trapped in.
Imagine being trapped here, faced with eternal torment. I think I'd rather just die.
I don't fear the grave. But an eternal cycle of death and rebirth? I can't bear to think of it.
A terrible contraption by all estimations.
An awful fate, to be trapped here so long.
Imagine being tormented  in this place for so long. It makes me shudder.
A terrible fate, to be trapped here so long.

EditorData.NodeContext: SH: resigned. (generic fallback line - whether she killed or spared Nightsong is unknown)

Text.Value: With her free, Ketheric is exposed. We only have to strike.
Ketheric has the wrath of the heavens upon him now. And no hope of resurrection.
Ketheric Thorm's immortal no longer. He will know true death at our hands.

Can't wait to watch her cleave Ketheric's head in two.

Ketheric is vulnerable now. We should hasten to Moonrise, lest our angelic friend kills him before we have a chance to.
Ketheric will be vulnerable, now. All we need to do is strike.
With her free, Ketheric is exposed. We only have to strike.
Ketheric has the wrath of the heavens upon him now. And no hope of resurrection.
Ketheric is eternal no longer. We should strike now, while he's at his most fragile.
So much for Ketheric's immortality. Let's move - I want to see this angel of doom in action.
Can't wait to watch her break Ketheric's face.
Ketheric Thorm shall be vulnerable now. The time to strike is upon us.
Ketheric is vulnerable now. We should hasten to Moonrise, lest our angelic friend kills him before we have a chance to.
Ketheric is vulnerable - all we need to do is strike.
Well, she's Ketheric's now. Her fate's in his hands.
Rather ruthless of you to just hand her over like that.
You sacrificed the Nightsong to Ketheric. How proud you must feel. Shadowheart.
Hells, Shadowheart. You just... handed her over.
How could you, Shadowheart?
We just surrendered her...? She could have helped us put a stop to Ketheric Thorm!
She was defiant for a caged beast. Moonrise will break her.
Ketheric has her now. It's done.
Ketheric has form when it comes to cruelty, I'll give him that.
Ketheric Thorm has a lot to answer for.
The quest for power has driven lesser men than Ketheric to worse cruelties.
All that pain, for the sake of Ketheric's enduring power. Sickening.
And all for Ketheric's greed. What a bastard.
I knew Ketheric Thom was ruthless, but this is more than I could have fathomed he was capable of.
Ketheric and his minions were clever. Cruel, but clever.
